means: 人生或历史上的重要时期

sentence.Network_en: Uncle Richard intoned a chapter from the Bible and improvised a prayer.
sentence.Network_cn: 理查德叔叔吟诵了《圣经》中的一章，又即兴作了一段祈祷文。

sentence.Network_en: We saw in Chapter 16 how annual cash budgets are produced.
sentence.Network_cn: 在第16章我们了解了年度现金预算是怎样制订的。

sentence.Network_en: This point is developed further at the end of this chapter.
sentence.Network_cn: 这一点在本章结尾处有进一步阐释。

lj.lj_ly: she can give chapter and verse on current legislation.
lj.lj_ls: 她能给出当前立法的精确典据。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French chapitre, from Latin capitulum, diminutive of caput 'head'

entry.def: A chapter is one of the parts that a book is divided into. Each chapter has a number, and sometimes a title.

example.ex: Chromium supplements were used successfully in the treatment of diabetes (see Chapter 4)...
example.tran: 铬补充剂被成功运用于治疗糖尿病(见第4章)。

example.ex: I took the title of this chapter from one of my favorite books.
example.tran: 我这章的标题来自我最喜欢的一本书。

entry.tran: (人生或历史上的)阶段，时期，篇章
entry.def: A chapter in someone's life or in history is a period of time during which a major event or series of related events takes place.

example.ex: This had been a particularly difficult chapter in Lebanon's recent history.
example.tran: 这在黎巴嫩的近代史上是个特别困难的时期。

example.ex: ...one of the most dramatic chapters of recent British politics.
example.tran: 英国政治近来最富戏剧性的阶段之一

entry.tran: 大教堂全体教士(或全体相关神职人员)
entry.def: A chapter is a group of Christian clergy who work in or who are connected with a cathedral.

example.ex: The Archbishop began his address, thanking the Dean and Chapter of Westminster for inviting him to the Abbey.
example.tran: 大主教在开始演讲之前，首先感谢威斯敏斯特大教堂的主教和全体教士邀请他来到这里。

entry.def: A chapter is a branch of a society or club.

example.ex: To find out more about cancer warning signs call your local chapter of the American Cancer Society.
example.tran: 想要了解更多有关癌症的征兆，请给美国癌症协会本地分会打电话。

entry.def: If you say that someone gives you chapter and verse on a particular subject, you are emphasizing that they tell you every detail about it.

example.ex: In the course of the evening he gave me chapter and verse on the mosses of the Islay peat bogs.
example.tran: 整个晚上，他向我详细讲述艾莱岛泥炭沼泽地上的各种青苔。

means.word_mean: 1. a subdivision of a written work; usually numbered and titled;

sentences.sentence: "he read a chapter every night before falling asleep"

means.word_mean: 2. any distinct period in history or in a person's life;

sentences.sentence: "the industrial revolution opened a new chapter in British history"
"the divorce was an ugly chapter in their relationship"

means.word_mean: 3. a local branch of some fraternity or association;
4. an ecclesiastical assembly of the monks in a monastery or even of the canons of a church
5. a series of related events forming an episode;

auth_sentence.content: There was a whole chapter devoted to this kid.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was a whole chapter devoted to this kid.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was a whole chapter devoted to this kid.

auth_sentence.content: The justice ministers also agreed on a seven-chapter memorandum.
auth_sentence.res_content: The justice ministers also agreed on a seven-chapter memorandum.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The justice ministers also agreed on a seven-chapter memorandum.

auth_sentence.content: Until then, there is still one unfinished chapter.
auth_sentence.res_content: Until then, there is still one unfinished chapter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Until then, there is still one unfinished chapter.

Sentence.sentence: They don't have time to read a chapter three or four times.
First, read a chapter with one pen in your hand and others next to you on the desk
Read at least several chapters at one sitting.

In the chapter on skyscrapers, for example, Mr. Smith touches on construction methods, the revolutionary invention of the automatic lift, the practicalities of living in the sky and the likelihood that, as cities become more crowded, apartment living will become the norm.
What does the author say in the chapter on skyscrapers

Smith has written a breezy guidebook, with a series of short chapters dedicated to specific aspects of urbanity - parks, say, or the various schemes that have been put forward over the years for building the perfect city.

sentences.en: The author devotes the first three chapters to the subject.
sentences.cn: 作者用前三章阐述这个问题。

jushi.english: The author devotes the first three chapters to the subject.
jushi.chinese: 作者用前三章阐述这个问题。

jushi.english: The Civil War was a sad chapter in American history.
jushi.chinese: 南北战争是美国历史上可悲的一页。
